course_title: Contextual Education Elective: Sin and Salvation: Wesleyan/Methodist Perspectives
class_notes: (ON CAMPUS) (Concurrent enrollment in CE 552A or any level of teaching parish or EASP Con Ed required; permission number required to enroll; request permission by emailing candlerregistrar@emory.edu beginning Monday, March 21, 2022)
course_description: In this course, Con Ed II students examine a range of Christian theological ways of understanding sin and salvation, with emphasis on Biblical, historic Wesleyan, and contemporary UMC understandings. The course asks students to integrate their learning with the Contextual Education II ecclesial setting, bringing information from their sites into the classroom and bringing classroom learning to life in their church placement.
